trans-unit.source: Connect remotely to your StorSimple device | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Connect remotely to your StorSimple device | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Explains how to configure your device for remote management and how to connect to Windows PowerShell for StorSimple via HTTP or HTTPS.
trans-unit.target: Explains how to configure your device for remote management and how to connect to Windows PowerShell for StorSimple via HTTP or HTTPS.

trans-unit.source: Connect remotely to your StorSimple device
trans-unit.target: Connect remotely to your StorSimple device

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use Windows PowerShell remoting to connect to your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: You can use Windows PowerShell remoting to connect to your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: When you connect this way, you will not see a menu.
trans-unit.target: When you connect this way, you will not see a menu.

trans-unit.source: (You see a menu only if you use the serial console on the device to connect.)
trans-unit.target: (You see a menu only if you use the serial console on the device to connect.)

trans-unit.source: With Windows PowerShell remoting, you connect to a specific runspace.
trans-unit.target: With Windows PowerShell remoting, you connect to a specific runspace.

trans-unit.source: You can also specify the display language.
trans-unit.target: You can also specify the display language.

trans-unit.source: For more information about using Windows PowerShell remoting to manage your device, go to <link><linkText>Use Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to administer your StorSimple device</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about using Windows PowerShell remoting to manage your device, go to <link><linkText>Use Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to administer your StorSimple device</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial explains how to configure your device for remote management and then how to connect to Windows PowerShell for StorSimple.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial explains how to configure your device for remote management and then how to connect to Windows PowerShell for StorSimple.

trans-unit.source: You can use HTTP or HTTPS to connect via Windows PowerShell remoting.
trans-unit.target: You can use HTTP or HTTPS to connect via Windows PowerShell remoting.

trans-unit.source: However, when you are deciding how to connect to Windows PowerShell for StorSimple, consider the following:
trans-unit.target: However, when you are deciding how to connect to Windows PowerShell for StorSimple, consider the following:

trans-unit.source: Connecting directly to the device serial console is secure but connecting to the serial console over network switches is not.
trans-unit.target: Connecting directly to the device serial console is secure but connecting to the serial console over network switches is not.

trans-unit.source: Be cautious of the security risk when connecting to the device serial console over network switches.
trans-unit.target: Be cautious of the security risk when connecting to the device serial console over network switches.

trans-unit.source: Connecting through an HTTP session might offer more security than connecting through the serial console over the network.
trans-unit.target: Connecting through an HTTP session might offer more security than connecting through the serial console over the network.

trans-unit.source: Although this is not the most secure method, it is acceptable on trusted networks.
trans-unit.target: Although this is not the most secure method, it is acceptable on trusted networks.

trans-unit.source: Connecting through an HTTPS session with a self-signed certificate is the most secure and the recommended option.
trans-unit.target: Connecting through an HTTPS session with a self-signed certificate is the most secure and the recommended option.

trans-unit.source: You can connect remotely to the Windows PowerShell interface.
trans-unit.target: You can connect remotely to the Windows PowerShell interface.

trans-unit.source: However, remote access to your StorSimple device via the Windows PowerShell interface is not enabled by default.
trans-unit.target: However, remote access to your StorSimple device via the Windows PowerShell interface is not enabled by default.

trans-unit.source: You need to enable remote management on the device first, and then on the client that is used to access your device.
trans-unit.target: You need to enable remote management on the device first, and then on the client that is used to access your device.

trans-unit.source: Connect through HTTP
trans-unit.target: Connect through HTTP

trans-unit.source: Connecting to Windows PowerShell for StorSimple through an HTTP session offers more security than connecting through the serial console of your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Connecting to Windows PowerShell for StorSimple through an HTTP session offers more security than connecting through the serial console of your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Although this is not the most secure method, it is acceptable on trusted networks.
trans-unit.target: Although this is not the most secure method, it is acceptable on trusted networks.

trans-unit.source: You can use either the Azure Portal or the serial console to configure remote management.
trans-unit.target: You can use either the Azure Portal or the serial console to configure remote management.

trans-unit.source: Select from the following procedures:
trans-unit.target: Select from the following procedures:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Use the Azure Portal to enable remote management over HTTP</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Use the Azure Portal to enable remote management over HTTP</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Use the serial console to enable remote management over HTTP</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Use the serial console to enable remote management over HTTP</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: After you enable remote management, use the following procedure to prepare the client for a remote connection.
trans-unit.target: After you enable remote management, use the following procedure to prepare the client for a remote connection.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Prepare the client for remote connection</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Prepare the client for remote connection</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Use the Azure Portal to enable remote management over HTTP
trans-unit.target: Use the Azure Portal to enable remote management over HTTP

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps in the Azure Portal to enable remote management over HTTP.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps in the Azure Portal to enable remote management over HTTP.

trans-unit.source: To enable remote management through the Azure Portal
trans-unit.target: To enable remote management through the Azure Portal

trans-unit.source: Access Devices > Configure for your device.
trans-unit.target: Access Devices > Configure for your device.

trans-unit.source: Scroll down to the Remote Management section.
trans-unit.target: Scroll down to the Remote Management section.

trans-unit.source: Set Enable Remote Management to Yes.
trans-unit.target: Set Enable Remote Management to Yes.

trans-unit.source: You can now choose to connect using HTTP.
trans-unit.target: You can now choose to connect using HTTP.

trans-unit.source: (The default is to connect over HTTPS.)
trans-unit.target: (The default is to connect over HTTPS.)

trans-unit.source: Make sure that HTTP is selected.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that HTTP is selected.

trans-unit.source: Connecting over HTTP is acceptable only on trusted networks.
trans-unit.target: Connecting over HTTP is acceptable only on trusted networks.

trans-unit.source: Click Save at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Save at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Use the serial console to enable remote management over HTTP
trans-unit.target: Use the serial console to enable remote management over HTTP

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps on the device serial console to enable remote management.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps on the device serial console to enable remote management.

trans-unit.source: To enable remote management through the device serial console
trans-unit.target: To enable remote management through the device serial console

trans-unit.source: On the serial console menu, select option 1.
trans-unit.target: On the serial console menu, select option 1.

trans-unit.source: For more information about using the serial console on the device, go to <link><linkText>Connect to Windows PowerShell for StorSimple via device serial console</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about using the serial console on the device, go to <link><linkText>Connect to Windows PowerShell for StorSimple via device serial console</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: At the prompt, type: Enable-HcsRemoteManagement –AllowHttp
trans-unit.target: At the prompt, type: Enable-HcsRemoteManagement –AllowHttp

trans-unit.source: You will be notified about the security vulnerabilities of using HTTP to connect to the device.
trans-unit.target: You will be notified about the security vulnerabilities of using HTTP to connect to the device.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, confirm by typing Y.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, confirm by typing Y.

trans-unit.source: Verify that HTTP is enabled by typing: Get-HcsSystem
trans-unit.target: Verify that HTTP is enabled by typing: Get-HcsSystem

trans-unit.source: Verify that the RemoteManagementMode field shows HttpsAndHttpEnabled.The following illustration shows these settings in PuTTY.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the RemoteManagementMode field shows HttpsAndHttpEnabled.The following illustration shows these settings in PuTTY.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Serial HTTPS and HTTP enabled</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Serial HTTPS and HTTP enabled</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Prepare the client for remote connection
trans-unit.target: Prepare the client for remote connection

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps on the client to enable remote management.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps on the client to enable remote management.

trans-unit.source: To prepare the client for remote connection
trans-unit.target: To prepare the client for remote connection

trans-unit.source: Start a Windows PowerShell session as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Start a Windows PowerShell session as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Type the following command to add the IP address of the StorSimple device to the client’s trusted hosts list:
trans-unit.target: Type the following command to add the IP address of the StorSimple device to the client’s trusted hosts list:

trans-unit.source: Set-Item wsman:\localhost\Client\TrustedHosts -Concatenate -Force
trans-unit.target: Set-Item wsman:\localhost\Client\TrustedHosts -Concatenate -Force

trans-unit.source: Replace <html></html> with the IP address of your device; for example:
trans-unit.target: Replace <html></html> with the IP address of your device; for example:

trans-unit.source: Set-Item wsman:\localhost\Client\TrustedHosts 10.126.173.90 -Concatenate -Force
trans-unit.target: Set-Item wsman:\localhost\Client\TrustedHosts 10.126.173.90 -Concatenate -Force

trans-unit.source: Type the following command to save the device credentials in a variable:
trans-unit.target: Type the following command to save the device credentials in a variable:

trans-unit.source: $cred = Get-Credential
trans-unit.target: $cred = Get-Credential

trans-unit.source: In the dialog box that appears:
trans-unit.target: In the dialog box that appears:

trans-unit.source: Type the user name in this format: device_ip\SSAdmin.
trans-unit.target: Type the user name in this format: device_ip\SSAdmin.

trans-unit.source: Type the device administrator password that was set when the device was configured with the setup wizard.
trans-unit.target: Type the device administrator password that was set when the device was configured with the setup wizard.

trans-unit.source: The default password is Password1.
trans-unit.target: The default password is Password1.

trans-unit.source: Start a Windows PowerShell session on the device by typing this command:
trans-unit.target: Start a Windows PowerShell session on the device by typing this command:

trans-unit.source: Enter-pssession -Credential $cred -ConfigurationName SSAdminConsole -ComputerName
trans-unit.target: Enter-pssession -Credential $cred -ConfigurationName SSAdminConsole -ComputerName

trans-unit.source: To create a Windows PowerShell session for use with the StorSimple virtual device, append the –port parameter and specify the public port that you configured in Remoting for StorSimple Virtual Appliance.
trans-unit.target: To create a Windows PowerShell session for use with the StorSimple virtual device, append the –port parameter and specify the public port that you configured in Remoting for StorSimple Virtual Appliance.

trans-unit.source: At this point, you should have an active remote Windows PowerShell session to the device.
trans-unit.target: At this point, you should have an active remote Windows PowerShell session to the device.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>PowerShell remoting using HTTP</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>PowerShell remoting using HTTP</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Connect through HTTPS
trans-unit.target: Connect through HTTPS

trans-unit.source: Connecting to Windows PowerShell for StorSimple through an HTTPS session is the most secure and recommended method of remotely connecting to your Microsoft Azure StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Connecting to Windows PowerShell for StorSimple through an HTTPS session is the most secure and recommended method of remotely connecting to your Microsoft Azure StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: The following procedures explain how to set up the serial console and client computers so that you can use HTTPS to connect to Windows PowerShell for StorSimple.
trans-unit.target: The following procedures explain how to set up the serial console and client computers so that you can use HTTPS to connect to Windows PowerShell for StorSimple.

trans-unit.source: You can use either the Azure Portal or the serial console to configure remote management.
trans-unit.target: You can use either the Azure Portal or the serial console to configure remote management.

trans-unit.source: Select from the following procedures:
trans-unit.target: Select from the following procedures:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Use the Azure Portal to enable remote management over HTTPS</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Use the Azure Portal to enable remote management over HTTPS</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Use the serial console to enable remote management over HTTPS</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Use the serial console to enable remote management over HTTPS</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: After you enable remote management, use the following procedures to prepare the host for a remote management and connect to the device from the remote host.
trans-unit.target: After you enable remote management, use the following procedures to prepare the host for a remote management and connect to the device from the remote host.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Prepare the host for remote management</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Prepare the host for remote management</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Connect to the device from the remote host</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Connect to the device from the remote host</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Use the Azure Portal to enable remote management over HTTPS
trans-unit.target: Use the Azure Portal to enable remote management over HTTPS

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps in the Azure Portal to enable remote management over HTTPS.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps in the Azure Portal to enable remote management over HTTPS.

trans-unit.source: To enable remote management over HTTPS from the Azure Portal
trans-unit.target: To enable remote management over HTTPS from the Azure Portal

trans-unit.source: Access Devices > Configure for your device.
trans-unit.target: Access Devices > Configure for your device.

trans-unit.source: Scroll down to the Remote Management section.
trans-unit.target: Scroll down to the Remote Management section.

trans-unit.source: Set Enable Remote Management to Yes.
trans-unit.target: Set Enable Remote Management to Yes.

trans-unit.source: You can now choose to connect using HTTPS.
trans-unit.target: You can now choose to connect using HTTPS.

trans-unit.source: (The default is to connect over HTTPS.)
trans-unit.target: (The default is to connect over HTTPS.)

trans-unit.source: Make sure that HTTPS is selected.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that HTTPS is selected.

trans-unit.source: Click Download Remote Management Certificate.
trans-unit.target: Click Download Remote Management Certificate.

trans-unit.source: Specify a location to save this file.
trans-unit.target: Specify a location to save this file.

trans-unit.source: You will need to install this certificate on the client or host computer that you will use to connect to the device.
trans-unit.target: You will need to install this certificate on the client or host computer that you will use to connect to the device.

trans-unit.source: Click Save at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Save at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Use the serial console to enable remote management over HTTPS
trans-unit.target: Use the serial console to enable remote management over HTTPS

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps on the device serial console to enable remote management.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps on the device serial console to enable remote management.

trans-unit.source: To enable remote management through the device serial console
trans-unit.target: To enable remote management through the device serial console

trans-unit.source: On the serial console menu, select option 1.
trans-unit.target: On the serial console menu, select option 1.

trans-unit.source: For more information about using the serial console on the device, go to <link><linkText>Connect to Windows PowerShell for StorSimple via device serial console</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about using the serial console on the device, go to <link><linkText>Connect to Windows PowerShell for StorSimple via device serial console</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: At the prompt, type:
trans-unit.target: At the prompt, type:

trans-unit.source: Enable-HcsRemoteManagement
trans-unit.target: Enable-HcsRemoteManagement

trans-unit.source: This should enable HTTPS on your device.
trans-unit.target: This should enable HTTPS on your device.

trans-unit.source: Verify that HTTPS has been enabled by typing:
trans-unit.target: Verify that HTTPS has been enabled by typing:

trans-unit.source: Get-HcsSystem
trans-unit.target: Get-HcsSystem

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the RemoteManagementMode field shows Https Enabled.The following illustration shows these settings in PuTTY.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the RemoteManagementMode field shows Https Enabled.The following illustration shows these settings in PuTTY.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Serial HTTPS enabled</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Serial HTTPS enabled</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the output of Get-HcsSystem, copy the serial number of the device and save it for later use.
trans-unit.target: From the output of Get-HcsSystem, copy the serial number of the device and save it for later use.

trans-unit.source: The serial number maps to the CN name in the certificate.
trans-unit.target: The serial number maps to the CN name in the certificate.

trans-unit.source: Obtain a remote management certificate by typing:
trans-unit.target: Obtain a remote management certificate by typing:

trans-unit.source: Get-HcsRemoteManagementCert
trans-unit.target: Get-HcsRemoteManagementCert

trans-unit.source: A certificate similar to the following will appear.
trans-unit.target: A certificate similar to the following will appear.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Get remote management certificate</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Get remote management certificate</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Copy the information in the certificate from -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE----- to -----END CERTIFICATE----- into a text editor such as Notepad, and save it as a .cer file.
trans-unit.target: Copy the information in the certificate from -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE----- to -----END CERTIFICATE----- into a text editor such as Notepad, and save it as a .cer file.

trans-unit.source: (You will copy this file to your remote host when you prepare the host.)
trans-unit.target: (You will copy this file to your remote host when you prepare the host.)

trans-unit.source: To generate a new certificate, use the Set-HcsRemoteManagementCert cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To generate a new certificate, use the Set-HcsRemoteManagementCert cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Prepare the host for remote management
trans-unit.target: Prepare the host for remote management

trans-unit.source: To prepare the host computer for a remote connection that uses an HTTPS session, perform the following procedures:
trans-unit.target: To prepare the host computer for a remote connection that uses an HTTPS session, perform the following procedures:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Import the .cer file into the root store of the client or remote host</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Import the .cer file into the root store of the client or remote host</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Add the device serial numbers to the hosts file on your remote host</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Add the device serial numbers to the hosts file on your remote host</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Each of these procedures is described below.
trans-unit.target: Each of these procedures is described below.

trans-unit.source: To import the certificate on the remote host
trans-unit.target: To import the certificate on the remote host

trans-unit.source: Right-click the .cer file and select Install certificate.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the .cer file and select Install certificate.

trans-unit.source: This will start the Certificate Import Wizard.
trans-unit.target: This will start the Certificate Import Wizard.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Certificate Import Wizard 1</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Certificate Import Wizard 1</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For Store location, select Local Machine, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: For Store location, select Local Machine, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: Select Place all certificates in the following store, and then click Browse.
trans-unit.target: Select Place all certificates in the following store, and then click Browse.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the root store of your remote host, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the root store of your remote host, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Certificate Import Wizard 2</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Certificate Import Wizard 2</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Finish.
trans-unit.target: Click Finish.

trans-unit.source: A message that tells you that the import was successful appears.
trans-unit.target: A message that tells you that the import was successful appears.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Certificate Import Wizard 3</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Certificate Import Wizard 3</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To add device serial numbers to the remote host
trans-unit.target: To add device serial numbers to the remote host

trans-unit.source: Start Notepad as an administrator, and then open the hosts file located at \Windows\System32\Drivers\etc.
trans-unit.target: Start Notepad as an administrator, and then open the hosts file located at \Windows\System32\Drivers\etc.

trans-unit.source: Add the following three entries to your hosts file: DATA 0 IP address, Controller 0 Fixed IP address, and Controller 1 Fixed IP address.
trans-unit.target: Add the following three entries to your hosts file: DATA 0 IP address, Controller 0 Fixed IP address, and Controller 1 Fixed IP address.

trans-unit.source: Enter the device serial number that you saved earlier.
trans-unit.target: Enter the device serial number that you saved earlier.

trans-unit.source: Map this to the IP address as shown in the following image.
trans-unit.target: Map this to the IP address as shown in the following image.

trans-unit.source: For Controller 0 and Controller 1, append Controller0 and Controller1 at the end of the serial number (CN name).
trans-unit.target: For Controller 0 and Controller 1, append Controller0 and Controller1 at the end of the serial number (CN name).

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Adding CN Name to hosts file</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Adding CN Name to hosts file</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Save the hosts file.
trans-unit.target: Save the hosts file.

trans-unit.source: Connect to the device from the remote host
trans-unit.target: Connect to the device from the remote host

trans-unit.source: Use Windows PowerShell and SSL to enter an SSAdmin session on your device from a remote host or client.
trans-unit.target: Use Windows PowerShell and SSL to enter an SSAdmin session on your device from a remote host or client.

trans-unit.source: The SSAdmin session maps to option 1 in the <link><linkText>serial console</linkText><title></title></link> menu of your device.
trans-unit.target: The SSAdmin session maps to option 1 in the <link><linkText>serial console</linkText><title></title></link> menu of your device.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following procedure on the computer from which you want to make the remote Windows PowerShell connection.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following procedure on the computer from which you want to make the remote Windows PowerShell connection.

trans-unit.source: To enter an SSAdmin session on the device by using Windows PowerShell and SSL
trans-unit.target: To enter an SSAdmin session on the device by using Windows PowerShell and SSL

trans-unit.source: Start a Windows PowerShell session as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Start a Windows PowerShell session as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Add the device IP address to the client’s trusted hosts by typing:
trans-unit.target: Add the device IP address to the client’s trusted hosts by typing:

trans-unit.source: Set-Item wsman:\localhost\Client\TrustedHosts -Concatenate -Force
trans-unit.target: Set-Item wsman:\localhost\Client\TrustedHosts -Concatenate -Force

trans-unit.source: Where <html></html> is the IP address of your device; for example:
trans-unit.target: Where <html></html> is the IP address of your device; for example:

trans-unit.source: Set-Item wsman:\localhost\Client\TrustedHosts 10.126.173.90 -Concatenate -Force
trans-unit.target: Set-Item wsman:\localhost\Client\TrustedHosts 10.126.173.90 -Concatenate -Force

trans-unit.source: Create a new credential by typing:
trans-unit.target: Create a new credential by typing:

trans-unit.source: $cred = new-object pscredential @("\SSAdmin", (convertto-securestring -force -asplaintext ""))
trans-unit.target: $cred = new-object pscredential @("\SSAdmin", (convertto-securestring -force -asplaintext ""))

trans-unit.source: Where is the IP address of DATA 0 for your device; for example, 10.126.173.90 as shown in the preceding image of the hosts file. Also, supply the administrator password for your device.
trans-unit.target: Where is the IP address of DATA 0 for your device; for example, 10.126.173.90 as shown in the preceding image of the hosts file. Also, supply the administrator password for your device.

trans-unit.source: Create a session by typing:
trans-unit.target: Create a session by typing:

trans-unit.source: $session = new-pssession -usessl -CN -credential $cred -configurationname "SSAdminConsole"
trans-unit.target: $session = new-pssession -usessl -CN -credential $cred -configurationname "SSAdminConsole"

trans-unit.source: For the CN name in the cmdlet, provide the **. This serial number was mapped to the IP address of DATA 0 in the hosts file on your remote host; for example, SHX0991003G44MT as shown in the following image.
trans-unit.target: For the CN name in the cmdlet, provide the **. This serial number was mapped to the IP address of DATA 0 in the hosts file on your remote host; for example, SHX0991003G44MT as shown in the following image.

trans-unit.source: Type:
trans-unit.target: Type:

trans-unit.source: Enter-PSSession $session
trans-unit.target: Enter-PSSession $session

trans-unit.source: You will need to wait a few minutes, and then you will be connected to your device via HTTPS over SSL.
trans-unit.target: You will need to wait a few minutes, and then you will be connected to your device via HTTPS over SSL.

trans-unit.source: You will see a message that indicates you are connected to your device.
trans-unit.target: You will see a message that indicates you are connected to your device.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>PowerShell remoting using HTTPS and SSL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>PowerShell remoting using HTTPS and SSL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Learn more about using Windows PowerShell to administer your StorSimple device</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Learn more about using Windows PowerShell to administer your StorSimple device</linkText><title></title></link>.
